body:
Comment 3: 
I don't care much but it seems just as easy to handle them correctly as guarding against
them. Also, if we don't allow them, we'd need at least one extra rule (a sentence) in
the spec. Permitting them does seem to be more regular, which is why I lean towards that
interpretation.

(As an aside, there are similar, but not related, corner cases with blank method names
in interfaces, see issues 6604, 6606. Not sure it does or should have any bearing on
this issue.)
